First the good things:
It is a very nice location and everything tasted fresh and handmade.
We we able to book for a group with short notice.
Now the reasons why I am only able to give 3 out of 5 points with a very very big amount of good will:
It was quite pricy and although the ingredients were fresh and nicely arranged, the taste was nothing special and not comparable with other experiences we had in this price category. 
The main reason why I found it a very unpleasant experience was the meal that our children got served. I understand that this kind of kitchen doesn‚Äôt serve special food for children, but the plate we got for them looked more like a persiflage of prison food than something that you get in a restaurant. It was one tiny potatoe (smaller than a ping pong ball) on one side and a grey sausage on the other side. No vegetables and just one potatoe.
Looking back, I am mad about myself for not complaining right there. 
The bill was a surprise as well. While paying, we went through the positions we had and as I didn‚Äôt want to make a fuss about small things, I also paid the coffee that at least 2 out of 3 persons hadn‚Äôt ordered, but consumed since we thought it was part of the menu.
I went through the bill the next day and simply don‚Äôt understand what has been extra charged as there are much more positions on it than it should be and it only says ‚Äúrestaurant‚Äù for every position.
Again, my fault for not checking it right away, but nothing that should happen.

All together, a not convincing experience and I would not recommend to visit.

My wife and I ordered the menu each. The first course was cured cod with various pur√©ed vegetables and legumes. This went superbly with the house white beer. Everything was amazing -- food of this quality would cost between five and ten times as much in Copenhagen.

You travel down a side road heading towards a park and think that surely your directions are wrong, then you turn a bend and what looks like a big house is set off to the rear of a car park.

I have had rather mixed results going to restaurants in Denmark. I'm never sure what will happen as the style of service, food etc are quite different from what I am used to. This restaurant exceeded expectations. It is in a nice location, is clean and decorated well. The staff were efficient and friendly and the meal was great. I had beef with bernaise sauce followed by a selection of icecreams. The beef was cooked beautifully, was moist and tender. There were a number of vegetables on the plate which looked a bit busy at first but they all added something to the dish. The strawberry qns chocolate icecreams  were particularly special. Overall great food, service, decent portion sizes and a nice red wine from their list made it a great meal.

I have tried nearly the whole menu and it is nice food. For those familiar with proper Thai food, this will satisfy your cravings. It's the best choice in Esbjerg, but it isn't anywhere near the quality of big city Thai places

I had the Pad Thai and some chicken wings. The Pad Thai tasted great. I was impressed, having just been to Thailand it tasted quite like the Pad Thai I tried there. If I visit this restaurant again I will ask for more spicy though since the "default" was quite mild.

Fantastic food and very good portions. Highly recomended. Excelent service, very fast and very nice people.

I tried the Pad Thai noodles, delicious, I asked to get them extra spicy, and that was delivered! The kitchen is open, so you can watch while they prepare your meal. I will definitely be back. For payment, they only accept danish visa or cash, luckily there is an ATM just down the road. I thought the portion of food was small.

Went there for dinner around 18:30. Decided to eat there. Ordered a chicken dish, which was ready after a short while. The food tasted good and was a bit spicy, but not too spicy. The portion was plenty and I was full after finishing.
This is a take away, but there are 5-6 bar stools and a long desk, so itis possible to eat there, but not for fine dining or family dinner.

I will definitely eat there again.
Basic good thai place. We went there for lunch with couple of collegues. Kitchen seemed clean and tidy and food was quite typical thai food without big surprises. Portions were a bit small.

Fantastic Thai-food and almost all their dishes are delicious. We have take-away from here 1-2 times every months. Normally we have some mixed spring rolls and then 1-2 chicken Plates. 2 chicken plates and 1 extra rice is plenty for 3 people. Try it :)

We had booked a table for a group of 15 people (will become important for the overall rating). I had a cauliflower soup as a starter which was alright but nothing special and as a main a Vienna Schnitzel (served the danish way with potatoes, a ton of peas, capers, anchovies and gravy) which was quite dissipating as it lacked flavour and the meat was surprisingly tough. It has however to be said that most other dishes where praised by those at the table.

The staff was very friendly although a bit young and hence unexperienced, nevertheless the staff was attentive and deserves praise.

The biggest disappointment and reason why I can't recommend this establishment and doubt that I will return to in the future is that they were unable to take individual payments. The staff informed us that at tables with more than 10 people the restaurant (and all other branches of Madklubben) were unable to charge individually but only in a lump sum. This praxis is not just completely unheard off for any restaurant anywhere in the world but also meant that the entire table spent the remaining time trying to sort out the payment of the meals within the group instead of simply enjoying the time and food at at the restaurant.

In the end the absurd payment practices of the restaurant tainted an otherwise enjoyable evening.
We were at Madklubben with the family. We all had 3 courses which all were fantastic. Good size and also really tasty. The  price-performance ratio is unbeatable. The staff was fast and friendly.

The restaurant is located nicely in the city centre and directly at the river. The view is amazing and the restaurant itself has a cozy atmosphere with welcoming and friendly staff.
What was bothering us, was that it is advertised as vegetarian friendly, but only had two or three vegetarian options on the whole menu. We asked if they could create us a vegetarian two course menu or a vegetarian tapas plate and they refused. So we stuck to the "vegan beef", which was surprisingly just two falafel Patty's with some veggies. I'd definitely recommend to change the name then from "beef" to "falafel" because it's misleading. The vegetables were delicious, but the falafel was the worst thing I ever ate. It was dry and tasted like frozen supermarket food. And: the pricing was weird.  Why does a meat burger cost less, then two falafel Patty's, which were clearly not homemade? Since when is meat cheaper then chickpeas? For what we got it was extremely expensive and very disappointing. I can't judge for meat options, and probably it is a good place to go for a piece of meat or fish, but vegetarians and vegans should avoid until they fix their menu.

They were busy but far too slow to show people to a vacant seat and serve guests.
But the food is fine and worth a visit.

This restaurant has served the best ribeye I have ever tasted, hand down.
Being served steak usually requires having a steak knife. In this case, it is not needed.

Not the cheapest restaurant in town, but well worth it.

Served between roasted dark malt bread, with pesto, salad, baked tomatoes and piment - not the traditional chicken sandwich, but with a successful twist. The sweet potato soup was equally well 
served with crisp local bacon, croutons and a side of light malt bread, with a crisp and salty crust. Thank you for a nice lunch.

We went there for lunch, and the food was amazing! The wine was good too, but the server was a bit young and distracted. We were sitting outside by the water in the sun which was absolutely amazing! Definitely a beautiful place to enjoy good food and wine

After a Tour to Koresand we returned to this restaurant to have a birthday lunch. It was quite dissapointing.

 Besides that the room was not tidy. A lot of tables stacked as if They did not plan to use it. One of the guests brought a dog into the restaurant without anyone noticed. 

On the good side - the restrooms are clean, the serving went quickly, the soda is cheap. Try one of the other cafees on the Island.
The coffee is not great but this is the only disappoitning thing about this bar/restaurant.  The local home cooked food was delicious and authentic.

Friendly staff, nice local beer, but food from a very limited menu was very average at best.

Wanted to check this place out so finally decided that now was the time. Arrived half an hour before kitchen opened but the staff was very friendly and suggested a drink before they could serve the tapas. My wife and I have lived in Spain for many years so we looked forward what this restaurant could offer. We had some Gambas al Ajillo (Shrimps in garlic oil) some aioli and mojo sauce, as well as a pintcho with serrano ham. The service was swift and courteous. The waitress informed that the portions were not big, just in case we were very hungry. Anyway portions were just as we expected for tapas (snack). Quality was good however seasoning of shrimps was for a scandinavian palet, were a spaniard would espect a lot more garlic and chili. Same for the Mojo sauce which could have been stronger and more finly ground. Missed some Papas Arrugadas on the menu from the Canary Islands, which could have gone well with the Mojo. But all in all a restaurant I will revisit. Total price for the event was 251 DKK including 2 draft beers.

During our walk around Esbjerg in the afternoon we already passed this old building with not one but 2 restaurants, side by side. As we were still in the city we decided to try this restaurant for our evening dinner. We drove to the harbor area by car as there is ample parking space particularly when the offices are empty in the early evening. We stepped in the central hall and were awaited by the person on the reception who pointed out that there was a choice between Spanish and more Danish food. Both menus could be looked at before making the decision and we opted for the Spanish restaurant El Puerto (the port). It was not very busy but a few tables were occupied we got a nice table in the center of the restaurant where our friendly Spanish waitress gave us an explanation on the way the ordering would go. But they also had a tapas menu written on the blackboard with 7 dishes for one price and enough food for two. We ordered that dish and also a Spanish beer from San Miguel (on tap). After about 20 minutes we got all our tapas plates, hot and cold in one go. For us this might also be served in 2 parts to make sure that all warm food could also be eaten hot. But we enjoyed all dishes and it was more than enough for 2 adults. The quality was good and it really tasted Spanish, which is a real compliment.
Always fantastic tasting food! We love it Every time we visit the places. Think we have been there 10 times in total. Love it!

I visited the restaurant with my mom.
We were both very happy with the service and food.
The restaurant is well decorated and it is easy to feel comfortable.
The waitress did a really good job and the food came quickly.

My husband got food poisoning after eating from here. I ordered a different dish, so I didn't have the same problem as him. Server was nice, but didn't really explain the menu well. Sangria is alright, but you don't get much.More

We had booked a table at 19:30 Satuday and aarived on time. There were not so many guests at the restaurant and not noisy. The waitress guided us to the table, we sat down and got the menu. We had several questions about the food, since we had no experince with tapas and she was very helpful.
After looking at the menu a while we ordered various dishes. We waited a while, but when the food arrived, we were really impressed. It lokked so good and one of the Chorizo saussages got fried on open fire in a small bowl on the table.well, the food did not only look good, it tasted fantastic and it was plenty for three grownup men.
The resaurant is in a house at the harbour. The are is nice with ships laying just outside. There is also a lot of room inside the restaurant and it seems quite open. Nice and quiet place.
When we payed the bill, we were surprised how cheap it was. This must be one of the best restaurants in Esbjerg.

This is one of the best Tapas restaurants I have ever tried. The food was so delicious and  well-made. Especially the shrimp was made to perfection. The entire family was able to find things they liked on the menu. 

The staff were super friendly and helpful. We were not sure how much food we need, since we were going to share, and the waitress was not trying to sell more food, but instead gave a realistic picture of the size of the dishes. The food was brought out very quickly and to top it all of it was not very expensive at all.

The atmosphere of the restaurant is very cosy, even though the food could easily be served at a fancy, upscale restaurant. 

I cannot wait to go back here again.

Great place, excellent ingredients, fresh yummy bagels.  Service is fantastic!  Easy free parking at Fotex.

Unfortunately the menu is not in English. 
I took the brunch as I didn't know what to take, for same price I found some much better brunch in Esbjerg with open buffet.

Tried this place for the first time and ordered a bagel. It was a bit busy and was warned about the waiting time. It was after all Halloween.
The bagel taste a bit burnt in places, but I am sure itwould be good if correctly made.

We went to the Aunt Betty in the new shopping mall "Broen" (The Bridge) and had a nice meal. 
Prices are reasonable and taste & quality good. 
Service is fine. Note that you need to go to the counter to order. They will then bring the food to your table. 
Nice place for a snack or quick lunch/dinner.

Whenever I go to Esbjerg I make a point of getting at least one lunch from Aunt Bettys.

The bagels are made fresh in house and are filled exactly to your specific requirements by the staff as you wait. The coffee is lovely and the atmosphere is very nice and welcoming.

In addition, as I speak only a little Danish, the staff spoke very good English,  which was a life saver for me when ordering. 

Will be going back next time I'm in Esbjerg, and I'm looking forward to it!

Went with the family for Saturday night dinner. Had blue mussels as a starter, wich was a decent quality experience. I ordered halibut for main course, but they told me I could have cod instead. Fair enough.

The wife had ordered the traditional Danish dish Stjerneskud, but the white bread was a huge brick, soaked in butter. My cod dish was poor. A lot of nuts and only appx. 100 g slightly overcooked cod. Not many taste notes...
Oh and the staff... The spent most of their time trying to light a fake fireplace without any luck. Only limited attention to us and other tables.

Needs to be said that they did apologise for the missing attention, however more their loss than ours.
Hope they will get the terrace heaters for later this summer, since it will be much more attractive to sit outside watching the sun set.

Another night out in Esbjerg, exploring the town.
On the way over to the Scandic Hotel, asked the taxi driver for good nearby restaurant recommendations, as i didn't want to eat at the hotel, and he pointed me in the direction of Joci Sushi. I wasn't expecting a Japanese restaurant in Esbjerg, so thought i'd give it a wirl.
I was shown straight in, and all of the staff spoke good english, but i don't think they spoke Danish at all, as they used english with the locals as well - still not an issue.
Ordered a couple of dishes, including Tempura roll, which was OK, but bland by Japanese tastes - though probably westernised to suit Danish palates.   
The food was reasonable priced by Denmark prices.
I'm also not sure the staff were Japanese, i think Chinese by their accents - though could explain the non-authentic tasting food!
Overall, it was an OK average meal - though not sure i'd return in a hurry.
